The 'Cleveland Browns' are a professional American football franchise based in
Cleveland, Ohio. They are currently members of the North Division of the
American Football Conference (AFC) of the National Football League (NFL). Their
current home field is FirstEnergy Stadium (called Cleveland Browns Stadium from
its opening in 1999 to 2012). Their administrative offices and
training facilities are located in Berea, Ohio. The Browns' official colors are
burnt orange, seal brown, and white. They are unique among the 32 member
franchises of the National Football League in that they do not have a helmet
logo; the logoless helmet serves as their official primary logo.

The Cleveland Browns were founded in 1945 by businessman Arthur B. âMickeyâ
McBride as a charter member of the All-America Football Conference (AAFC), which
began play the following year. They were named for their first head coach, Paul
Brown. The Browns dominated the AAFC, compiling a 47-4-3 record over its four
active seasons and winning the championship in each of
them. [http://www.pigskinacademy.com/Cleveland_Browns.html Cleveland Browns-
Team history] Following the AAFC's demise after the 1949 season, the
Cleveland Browns were one of three franchises invited to join the NFL (the
others were the San Francisco 49ers and the original Baltimore Colts). The
Browns won a championship in their inaugural NFL season, as well as in the 1954,
1955, and 1964 seasons. From 1965 to 1995, they made the playoffs 14 times, but
to date, have never won another championship.

On November 6, 1995, Art Modell, who had purchased the Browns in 1961, announced
he was relocating the franchise to Baltimore, Maryland after the season. The
controversy caused by the decision was immediate and profound; numerous
lawsuits, including fans' and ticketholders' were filed to prevent the move.
Ultimately, a compromise was reached: Modell was allowed to relocate his team,
but he relinquished rights to the Cleveland Browns' name, colors, logos, and
history; they were kept in trust for an expansion Browns franchise which would
assume them. The Browns' operations were suspended for the next three seasons.
During this period of inactivity, Cleveland Municipal Stadium was demolished and
the new Cleveland Browns Stadium (now FirstEnergy Stadium) was built on the
site, and the late Al Lerner, a former friend and business partner of Art
Modell's, was approved as owner. [http://articles.baltimoresun.com/1998-09-
09/sports/1998252036_1_lerner-modell-ravens-owner With Modell's endorsement,
Lerner awarded Browns Ravens owner pushed for a unanimous vote for former
friend, partner - Baltimore Sun] Modell's new franchise was named the
Baltimore Ravens.

Since resuming operations in 1999, the Cleveland Browns have had very limited
success, compiling a 73-151 record through the 2012 season. They have had two
winning seasons â a 9-7 record in 2002 and a 10-6 record in 2007 â and qualified
for the playoffs in the former as a wild card team. [http://www.pro-football-
reference.com/teams/cle/ Cleveland Browns Team Encyclopedia - Pro-Football-
Reference.com] They have had seven head coaches in that time. Their
current head coach is Rob Chudzinski, who is entering his first year.
